item.title: Data manipulation in RStudio
item.description: Introduction Dataset Subset a dataset Based on row or column number Based on variable names Based on one or multiple criterion Create a new variable Introduction Not all datasets are as clean and tidy as you would expect. Therefore, after importing your dataset into RStudio, most of the time you will need to prepare it before performing any statistical analyses. Data manipulation can even sometimes take longer than the actual analyses when the quality of the data is poor.

item.description: What is R and RStudio? R R is nothing more than a programming language. At the time of writing, this language is (one of) the leading program in statistics, although not the only programming language used by statisticians.

item.title: Hello World!
item.description: This is the first post for the blog Stats and R, just to introduce it. This blog aims at helping academics (mainly students) and professionals (working with data) to grasp important concepts in statistics and to apply them in R. Thanks in advance for reading. As always, if you find a mistake/bug or if you have any questions do not hesitate to let me know in the comment section of the corresponding article, raise an issue on GitHub or contact me.
